TASKS_ACTIVATE.description: Activate NFC peripheral for incoming and outgoing frames, change state to activated

TASKS_SENSE.description: Enable NFC sense field mode, change state to sense mode

TASKS_STARTTX.description: Start transmission of a outgoing frame, change state to transmit

TASKS_GOIDLE.description: Force state machine to IDLE state

TASKS_GOSLEEP.description: Force state machine to SLEEP_A state

EVENTS_READY.description: The NFC peripheral is ready to receive and send frames

EVENTS_TXFRAMESTART.description: Marks the start of the first symbol of a transmitted frame

EVENTS_TXFRAMEEND.description: Marks the end of the last transmitted on-air symbol of a frame

EVENTS_RXFRAMESTART.description: Marks the end of the first symbol of a received frame

EVENTS_RXFRAMEEND.description: Received data have been checked (CRC, parity) and transferred to RAM, and EasyDMA has ended accessing the RX buffer

EVENTS_ERROR.description: NFC error reported. The ERRORSTATUS register contains details on the source of the error.

EVENTS_RXERROR.description: NFC RX frame error reported. The FRAMESTATUS.RX register contains details on the source of the error.

EVENTS_ENDRX.description: RX buffer (as defined by PACKETPTR and MAXLEN) in Data RAM full.

EVENTS_ENDTX.description: Transmission of data in RAM has ended, and EasyDMA has ended accessing the TX buffer

EVENTS_AUTOCOLRESSTARTED.description: Auto collision resolution process has started

EVENTS_COLLISION.description: NFC Auto collision resolution error reported.

EVENTS_SELECTED.description: NFC Auto collision resolution successfully completed

EVENTS_STARTED.description: EasyDMA is ready to receive or send frames.

FRAMEDELAYTIMEOUT.description: No STARTTX task triggered before expiration of the time set in FRAMEDELAYMAX

NFCFIELDTOOSTRONG.description: Field level is too high at max load resistance

NFCFIELDTOOWEAK.description: Field level is too low at min load resistance

CURRENTLOADCTRL.description: Current value driven to the NFC Load Control
Current value driven to the NFC Load Control

FIELDPRESENT.description: Indicates the presence or not of a valid field
Indicates the presence or not of a valid field. Available only in the activated state.

LOCKDETECT.description: Indicates if the low level has locked to the field

FRAMEDELAYMIN.description: Minimum frame delay in number of 13.56 MHz clocks

FRAMEDELAYMAX.description: Maximum frame delay in number of 13.56 MHz clocks

FRAMEDELAYMODE.description: Configuration register for the Frame Delay Timer
Configuration register for the Frame Delay Timer

FreeRun.description: Transmission is independent of frame timer and will start when the STARTTX task is triggered. No timeout.

Window.description: Frame is transmitted between FRAMEDELAYMIN and FRAMEDELAYMAX

ExactVal.description: Frame is transmitted exactly at FRAMEDELAYMAX

WindowGrid.description: Frame is transmitted on a bit grid between FRAMEDELAYMIN and FRAMEDELAYMAX

PACKETPTR.description: Packet pointer for TXD and RXD data storage in Data RAM

PTR.description: Packet pointer for TXD and RXD data storage in Data RAM. This address is a byte aligned RAM address.

MAXLEN.description: Size of allocated for TXD and RXD data storage buffer in Data RAM
Size of allocated for TXD and RXD data storage buffer in Data RAM

NFCID1_LAST.description: Last NFCID1 part (4, 7 or 10 bytes ID)

NFCID1_Z.description: NFCID1 byte Z (very last byte sent)

NFCID1_2ND_LAST.description: Second last NFCID1 part (7 or 10 bytes ID)

NFCID1_3RD_LAST.description: Third last NFCID1 part (10 bytes ID)

BITFRAMESDD.description: Bit frame SDD as defined by the b5:b1 of byte 1 in SENS_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

RFU5.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

NFCIDSIZE.description: NFCID1 size. This value is used by the Auto collision resolution engine.

PLATFCONFIG.description: Tag platform configuration as defined by the b4:b1 of byte 2 in SENS_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

RFU74.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

RFU10.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

CASCADE.description: Cascade bit (controlled by hardware, write has no effect)

RFU43.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

PROTOCOL.description: Protocol as defined by the b7:b6 of SEL_RES response in the NFC Forum, NFC Digital Protocol Technical Specification

RFU7.description: Reserved for future use. Shall be 0.

POLARITY.description: When In task mode: Operation to be performed on output when OUT[n] task is triggered. When In event mode: Operation on input that shall trigger IN[n] event.

None.description: Task mode: No effect on pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: no IN[n] event generated on pin activity.

LoToHi.description: Task mode: Set pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when rising edge on pin.

HiToLo.description: Task mode: Clear pin from OUT[n] task. Event mode: Generate IN[n] event when falling edge on pin.

Toggle.description: Task mode: Toggle pin from OUT[n]. Event mode: Generate IN[n] when any change on pin.

OUTINIT.description: When in task mode: Initial value of the output when the GPIOTE channel is configured. When in event mode: No effect.

Low.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

High.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is high

Erase all non-volatile memory including UICR registers. Note that code erase has to be enabled by CONFIG.EEN before the UICR can be erased.

ERASEUICR.description: Register for erasing User Information Configuration Registers
Register starting erase of all User Information Configuration Registers. Note that code erase has to be enabled by CONFIG.EEN before the UICR can be erased.

Disabled.description: Disable cache. Invalidates all cache entries.

TASKS_NEXTSTEP.description: Steps by one value in the current sequence on all enabled channels if DECODER.MODE=NextStep. Does not cause PWM generation to start it was not running.
